claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

extracted_evidence.quote: The Flublok Quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4, Sanofi) is manufactured without chicken eggs, resulting in a recombinant hemagglutinin protein that is genetically identical to that in the selected strain.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that Flublok's hemagglutinin protein is genetically identical to that in the selected strain, supporting the claim that Flublok ensures an identical antigenic match with the WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

extracted_evidence.quote: In traditional quadrivalent standard dose inactivated influenza vaccines (SD-IIV4), chicken eggs are used to manufacture the vaccine strain. The recombinant formulation is not susceptible to antigenic drift during manufacturing.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote explains that unlike egg-based vaccines, the recombinant (Flublok) formulation avoids antigenic drift during manufacturing, supporting the claim that it maintains an identical antigenic match to the selected strains.
